spotInfo.hazards: Shallow areas, swimmers in summer, fishing nets
spotInfo.season: May-October (peak: Jul-Aug). Strong winds common in autumn/winter but cold water requires thick wetsuit. Summer offers warmest water but can be crowded.
spotInfo.description: Jastarnia is one of Poland's most popular kitesurfing spots, located on the Hel Peninsula. The spot offers excellent conditions with westerly winds and a wide sandy beach perfect for launching. The shallow lagoon side is ideal for beginners, while the open Baltic Sea side provides more challenging conditions for advanced riders.

spotInfo.launch: Usually grass on the bay side, Sandy Beach on the sea side
spotInfo.hazards: Crowded in summer, swimmers, fishing nets, campings near the shore
spotInfo.season: May-September. Very popular in summer, with many kiteschools and rental options.
spotInfo.description: Chałupy is a famous kitesurfing village on the Hel Peninsula, well known among Polish kiters. It offers flat water in the Puck Bay lagoon and a lively kitesurfing community.

spotInfo.type: Sand spit, shallow water near spit, deep water further
spotInfo.hazards: Shallow sandbanks, strong currents outside lagoon, depending on wind direction you may be offshore
spotInfo.season: May-October, with best winds in autumn.
spotInfo.description: Rewa is a very popular kitesurfing spot near Gdynia, known for its sand spit dividing the Puck Bay. It provides shallow, safe water near shore for beginners and good training conditions. Depending on the wind direction (W or E), on the one side of the spit, we can have completely flat water great for kite freestyle enthusiasts.
